result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) was dismissed by the court.

  • James Robert Held was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $600.00 plus all  mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges, including $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge.  To be paid through collection of sums by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.

08-27-15/ William W Brash
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended to include a TOTAL of 167 days of sentence credit
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other time being served.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain mental health assessment-if necessary,  successfully complete  follow up treatment. Take presribed medication only as prescribed by physician.

No drug dealing or association with drug community, drug users/dealers or drug houses.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Pay all supervision fees.
Obtain AODA assessment. Successfully complete follow up treatment. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Prvoide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

Original Transcript MOTION HEARING  (46 pages) commencing AUGUST 26, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant James Robert Held in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant James Robert Held in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Attorney Golden appears as successor counsel.  Defense ordered transcripts as to motion hearings held on 8-15-14 and 8-26-14.  Status date selected with the parties.  Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James Robert Held in court with attorney Brian C. Hagner.  Defendant James Robert Held in custody.  Jeremy Arn for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Status conference.   Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw heard and granted by the Court.  Attorney Hagner informs the court that the defendant's financial circumstances have changed possible making him eligible for public defender representation (Attorney Hagner court appointed).  Attorney Hagner to notify the Public Defender's office of the need of income evaluation/appointment of counsel.  Defendant wishes to be heard on bail; the Court to revisit the issue on bail on the next date if new counsel raises bail motion.  Status conference scheduled for November 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brian C. Hagner in court, defendant James Robert Held not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Defendant has been convicted of OWI 4th and scheduled to be sentenced on 10-08-14 before Branch 24.  Defense indicates that the speedy trial demand is not applicable at this point.  
  Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James Robert Held in court with attorney Brian C. Hagner.  Defendant James Robert Held in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Decision as to Defense suppression motion.  The Court sets forth findings and ruling on the record.  Defense motion denied by the Court.  Motion to withdraw Exhibit #1 by the state granted. Case passed.  In chambers discussion held with counsel (off the record).  Case recalled.  Defense motion to adjourn jury trial calendared for today heard and granted by the court; no objection by the state.  Defense withdraws speedy trial demand on behalf of the defendant.  The Court holds colloquy with the defendant as to waiver of speedy trial demand.   Case adjourned for status before Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for September 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Filed:  Copy of certified records as to case 11CT000278.

Defendant James Robert Held in court with attorney Brian C. Hagner.  Defendant James Robert Held in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Off the record discussion held in chambers with the parties.  Motion hearing continued.  Testimony from Officer Danny Dawson (previously sworn).  Exhibit #1 received into evidence.  Oral argument from the state and defense.  Video played in open court.  Testimony from Officer Danny Dawson (previously sworn) resumed.  Court takes argument under advisement.  Case continued to 8-27-14 at 9:00 a.m. for Motion Hearing Decision and Jury Trial.

Defendant James Robert Held in court with attorney Brian C. Hagner.  Defendant James Robert Held in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for continuation of Suppression Motion Hearing held on 8-15-14.  Hearing proceeded.  Off the record, squad video played in open court.  On the record.  Sworn for the state:  Brown Deer Police Officer Danny Dawson.  Oral argument from the state and defense.  Court in recess to review cases cited.  Back on the record.  Rulings and findings set forth on the record.  Defense motion denied by the Court.  Case passed until 1:30 p.m.

Defendant James Robert Held in court with attorney Brian C. Hagner.  Defendant James Robert Held in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court on defense motion to suppress statements.  Off the record conference held between the court and the parties at the request of the parties.  On the record.  Statement made by defense.  Squad video viewed by the parties.  Statement made by defense and state.  Due to the lateness of the hour motion hearing to be continued on jury trial date.  Due to conflict of the court Jury Trial set for 8-27-14 rescheduled to 8-26-14.  
  Motion hearing scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Brian C. Hagner in court, defendant James Robert Held not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Hearing proceeded.  Appearance of defendant waived by defense for the purpose of this hearing.  Argument of defense and state heard.  Defense motion to modify bail denied for reasons set forth on the record.  Case remains set for Motion Hearing on 8-15-14 at 10:00 a.m. before Branch 21.
Defendant's Motion for Modification of Bail, filed.
Speedy trial demand entered.

Attorney Brian C Hagner in court, defendant James Robert Held not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Final pretrial hearing proceeded.  Appearance of the defendant waived for today's hearing by defense.  State's motion to adjourn jury trial heard (essential witness unavailable) and granted over the objection of defense.  Jury trial set for 7-30-14 to be rescheduled.  Defense enters DEMAND FOR SPEEDY TRIAL at this time.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements of the Defendant, filed.
filed.

Attorney Brian C Hagner in court, defendant James Robert Held not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Status conference held off the record between the parties.  On the record.  Appearance of defendant waived for today's hearing by defense.  Defense motion to hire investigator heard and granted. The Court approves up to five hours at a maximum cost of $150.00 in total.  Defense must petition the court for approval if fees are expected to exceed these limits.   Defense in a contest posture.  Parties advised that any and all motions must be filed in Br. 21 on or before the final pretrial date; hearing to be scheduled at the time of filing.  Motions must be heard prior to trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Brian C. Hagner in court, defendant James Robert Held not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ann Ballenger for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Final pretrial held between counsel.  Defense awaiting additional discovery and attempting to locate a witness. Defense motion to adjourn jury trial granted by the court.  Jury trial date converted to status conference.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brian C. Hagner in court, defendant James Robert Held not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ballenger for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Matter before the Court for Final pretrial.  ADA Lindsay not available for today's hearing.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brian C. Hagner in court, defendant James Robert Held not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Status conference held between counsel. Defense in a contest posture and request jury trial date.  Parties advised that any and all motions must be filed in Branch 21 on or before the final pretrial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Brian C Hagner in court, defendant James Robert Held not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in negotiations; defense received offer.  Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant James Robert Held in court with attorney Brian C Hagner.  Defendant James Robert Held in custody.  Katie Shaw, student intern under the supervision of Paul Hauer for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James Robert Held in court with Attorney Brian C Hagner.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Hearing proceeded.  Attorney Brian Hagner accepts court appointment at county rate.  The defendant agrees to reimburse Milwaukee County.  The Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $50.00 per month with the first payment due on 3-15-14 and additional payments due the 15th of each month thereafter until all fees and expenses are paid; other terms and conditions set forth in order.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James Robert Held in court, in custody.  Megan Carmody for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Colloquy conducted with the defendant.  Defendant reports that he was previously represented by Attorney Dudley Williams.  The Court appoints Attorney Brian Hagener at this time.  This clerk to contact Attorney Hagner regarding this matter.  Indigency hearing scheduled for February 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James Robert Held in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Court orders the case adjourned for cause and Indigency Hearing.  Same bail.  Indigency hearing scheduled for 02-03-2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM, drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James Robert Held in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant James Robert Held in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 3.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
